intro: Stylidium mucronifolium, commonly known as the acrid grass or acrid plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Haemodoraceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and distinctive, often reddish or yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its ability to produce a toxic, milky sap that can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Stylidium mucronifolium is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
